intro: Sium intermedium, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and white umbels of flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often have a distinctive scent when crushed. The roots are edible but can be toxic if not prepared properly.
